website_summaries.verdict: The Sigma 35mm F1.4 DG HSM is an impeccably sharp optic, and it works with all major SLR systems, netting it our Editors' Choice.

customer_reviews.title: What a disappointment
customer_reviews.text: All the hype around Sigma ART and this lens, all for not. Soft at every distance, used the docking station (waste of money) and tuned it right to the numbers and it's soft, soft, soft. I not so kind words, cheap 3rd party junk..... This lens at $757 is such a rip off. The Nikon 35mm 1.8G blows it away at $526. The ART thing is false, I tuned and shot it on my D610, D750 and Z7, my Nikon 35mm 1.8G kills it.
customer_reviews.author: S. W.

customer_reviews.title: Don't bother if AF performance matters to you
customer_reviews.text: Positives: Very good built - high quality feeling materials and heavy, metal construction. Design is modern and discrete. When in focus, the sharpness is excellent. Colors are nice. Bokeh is good. Negative: AF performance is terrible. At wide open, the lens is unacceptably unreliable in low light situations. Basically useless in these conditions. As with every Sigma I've ever tried - AF performance cannot come close to matching Nikon. It's pretty much hopeless. For all intents and purposes, this is a manual focus. If approached in that manner, it is a fine lens. Otherwise - avoid.
customer_reviews.author: rbtk

customer_reviews.title: Defective lens
customer_reviews.text: Within the last month the focus has become soft and difficult to nail. I've been a photographer for 8+ years now so this isn't user error. I believe the lens is defective. I shouldn't have to have it repaired after only buying it two months ago.
customer_reviews.author: Chloelafrance87

customer_reviews.title: Horrible autofocus even after calibrating
customer_reviews.text: I’m a professional photographer who has heard so much hype about this lens for years so I finally bought it. I do lot recommend it at all, unfortunately. The auto focus was off from the second I put it on my full frame body. I spent hours calibrating it just to still get soft, average images. I much prefer nikon’s 1.8 lens that I always get sharp images with and are much more affordable. It wasn’t worth the $800 price tag for just okay images, personally but the build and materials of the lens were excellent it just isn’t for me. The 1.4 was also impressive just the focusing made me return it right away.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: If you're on the fence, do yourself a favor and click "buy"
customer_reviews.text: I am in love with this lens. Way better than I had imagined. This has easily become my top two lens (this and my 70-200mm) and I am sorta kicking myself in the tush for not purchasing it sooner. Like with all your lenses, make sure you calibrate it to each of your bodies to make sure the focus is perfect (which if you're new to photography, sounds super complicated but it is easy- watch some youtube videos).
customer_reviews.author: J. Carroll

customer_reviews.title: All the warnings about focus? Listen to them!
customer_reviews.text: I've been able to fine-tune the focusing on this lens until it passes outside of the ~2' range. In the 2' to infinity range, focus when wide open is HORRIBLE back focused. Then at infinity, it flips to being horribly front focused. It feels like I have to pick having it either tack sharp from under 1' to ~5' and then completely out of focus until infinity., or out of focus around 5' and tack sharp at infinity. I love the rendition, bokeh, and sharpness when in focus, yet the big BUT has me eying a replacement, even after investing this much into the lens. Unfortunately testing and trying to calibrate it brought me outside of the return period.
customer_reviews.author: Lance

customer_reviews.title: Sharp as a razor
customer_reviews.text: What a lens!!!! It is so sharp - focus works well (do calibrate the lens however - my copy needed +11 on micro adjustment) The attached calibration image was shot at F1.4 - did I say it was sharp? At F1.8 it becomes a razor blade. Construction is very solid (it is quite heavy!) Once again - amazing lens.
customer_reviews.author: 1sttimemom

customer_reviews.title: I'm home.
customer_reviews.text: Using this with my Nikon D810, and it is such a spectacular performer. Very fast focus, with pristine clarity. It has reinvigorated my love of photography, and is a beautiful compliment to the D810. I like the added weight, and the frame is solid. I had no problems with focus or performance right out of the box. I wanted to test it out before getting the USB dock, and for now, it's not required.
customer_reviews.author: KcMsterpce

customer_reviews.title: Great Lens

customer_reviews.author: Leana

customer_reviews.title: It's good enough
customer_reviews.text: Very slight distortion, not great fringe, see background of photo. It's sharp for things in focus but also inconsistent with auto focus. My main beef is the fringe in the background. It's not horrible, just not that creamy and smooth compared to my Nikkor 105 or 50. But I still use it for group shots or other events where I don't have room to back up, or for personal use. It's not bad, it's actually good, just not amazing. I do like it, I am glad I have it.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: LOVE THIS LENS!

You do have to calibrate the lens before you use it for the first time but once you calibrate it then the focus is unreal! If you're on the fence, go for it. I like this a lot better than the nikon version.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry Smith

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!

It took me a while to make myself start buying "off brand" lenses. SInce "name" brand ones are cost prohibitive most of the time, I started considering them more. So glad I gave them a chance. I thought it would feel cheap and flimsy. This thing is pretty solid and has a little heft to it. I use it with my Nikon D800.

customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this lens. I’ve been able to take my photos to another level because of it! The auto focus is great, enhanced depth of field is great, and the way it lets light in is just amazing. If you’re on the fence about making the investment, I’d say go for it!

I started asking my other photographer friends and they had the same problem with this lens. I also asked my local camera shop and they said it's the most returned and calibrated lens they get. Just splurge and get the on-brand 35 mm for your camera.

customer_reviews.title: Happy

However, like others, I experienced spotty focus and lower light when shooting wide open. This was with a D800. It never did seem to nail focus accurately at 1.4. Also I compared it to a Zeiss 35mm f2 and there was a distinct difference in color and contrast. I can't say which was "better" because that is so subjective, but the difference was not subtle. I sent it back. If it won't autofocus reliably, I may as well have a manual focus lens.

My copy requires no micro adjustments on my D600 and is razor sharp from f1.4 all the way through. If I had one complaint it would be no weather sealing but I don;t tens to shoot in atmospheres where I personally would need it.

customer_reviews.text: Having had a number of 35mm lenses, including the 35L when I was with Canon, none come close to the Sigma. It has become an extremely versatile lens that excels in many areas. - Incredible sharpness wide open - Very good bokeh (when compared to other 35mm lenses) - Lack of coma wide open. customer_reviews.title: Exceptional.
customer_reviews.text: There's little I can say about this lens that hasn't already been said, but I will say that it's beyond fantastic. I shoot a lot of events and use this on a D600 alongside a 50mm f/1.4 on a D7100 and the results are great. This lens by itself has replaced my 24-70mm f/2.8 as my "go to" lens for general purpose photography. I'm looking forward to many years of both using and loving it.
customer_reviews.author: kendalltristan

customer_reviews.title: Simply Brilliant
customer_reviews.text: This lens has exceeded my expectations in all regards. Image quality is stunning, solid build quality, and, most importantly, autofocus is fast, silent and accurate. I use this lens with my Nikon D800 and the RAW files are amazing. As an ex-Canon shooter, I've owned the Canon 35L in the past and, while it's an impressive lens, the Sigma is on a different level. If you're on the fence about purchasing this lens, go for it. You'll save a few hundred dollars over the Nikon/Canon equivalents and have superior image quality. Well done, Sigma.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Best Choice
customer_reviews.text: Sigma has managed a great come back with its new "Art" line, and this 35mm F1.4 is one of the first bombs. And it did a great job. It has a really solid build and nice touch feeling. It is very sharp with low color fringes. The distortion is so little that can be ignored. The focus shift problem generally no longer exists in this generation. What can you say? For a lens that costed me less than $700, I could not ask for more. P.S. This is the first non-Nikkor lens that I ever bought. I am fully satisfied.
